org.threadly.litesockets

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.litesockets.Server
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TCPServer, UDPServer

    public abstract class Server
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the main Server Interface for litesockets.

    Any type of connection/open port will use this to "Accept" new client connections on. The Server has an Acceptor callback for new clients and a Closer callback for clean up when the socket is closed.

    Both the Server.ClientAcceptor and Server.ServerCloser callbacks can happen on multiple threads so use thread safety when dealing with those callbacks.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Server.ClientAcceptor
      This is the ClientAcceptor callback for the Server.
      static interface  Server.ServerCloser
      This is called once a Close is detected on the Servers Socket.

        public abstract SocketExecuterInterface getSocketExecuter()

      • getCloser

        Returns:
        the currently set Closer.

        Parameters:

      • getServerType

        public abstract SocketExecuterInterface.WireProtocol getServerType()

        This is used by the SocketExecuterInterface to know how to handle this Server when its added to it. Currently only UDP or TCP.

        Returns:
        returns the type of protocol this socket uses.

      • getClientAcceptor

        public abstract Server.ClientAcceptor getClientAcceptor()

        Gets the current Server.ClientAcceptor Callback for this Server.

        Returns:
        the currently set Server.ClientAcceptor.

      • setClientAcceptor

        public abstract void setClientAcceptor(Server.ClientAcceptor clientAcceptor)

        Set the Server.ClientAcceptor for this Server. This should be set before the Server is added to the SocketExecuterInterface. If its not you could miss pending client connections.

        Parameters:
        clientAcceptor - Sets the Server.ClientAcceptor callback for this server.

      • close

        public abstract void close()

        Close this servers Socket. Once closed you must construct a new Server to open it again.
